title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez sentenced to federal prison for mail theft and check fraud in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco sentenced to 35 months; Baez to two years, both with supervised release and ordered restitution.
Their scheme involved stealing, washing, and redepositing checks from USPS collection boxes into controlled accounts.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Milford teen Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE last year, invited to State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes, originally from Brazil, was detained in May 2025 in a collateral arrest targeting his father, but released on bond.
Gomes' detention sparked community protests; Rep. Moulton highlights his case as illustrating immigration system flaws.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a regrettable center-ice goal during Team USA's Olympic win over Denmark.
Swayman humorously addressed the goal, citing a loss of sight due to a 'flash screen' and joked about colorblindness.
United States overpowered Denmark with strong offense, while Swayman made 18 stops in his potentially sole Olympic start.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum may return from Achilles injury this season, attracting comments from NBA stars at All-Star weekend.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony anticipate Tatum's return, highlighting potential impact on Celtics' playoff hopes.
Tatum practiced with Celtics' G League, indicating significant rehab progress; his return could solidify Boston's roster.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to fill key positions ahead of free agency in March.
Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker are potential free agents the Patriots could target.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely presents a promising addition for the Patriots, especially with future needs at tight end.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV announced a partnership making ESPN the new streaming home for MLB games.
MLB.TV costs $134.99 as an add-on for ESPN Unlimited subscribers and $149.99 for non-subscribers, with a free ESPN Unlimited month.
New MLB.TV subscribers must register via the ESPN app, with auto-renew options and a push towards ESPN Unlimited subscriptions.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a G League practice with the Maine Celtics amid his Achilles injury rehabilitation.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. remarked that Tatum looked like himself during the practice session.
Celtics President Brad Stevens emphasized that Tatum will not return until fully recovered, with no specific timeline given.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. in WalletHub's 2026 analysis.
The state leads with over 47% of adults holding bachelor's degrees and nearly 22% with advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: The rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is up for auction, currently at $3.9 million with a potential price of $4.758 million.
The Wagner card was discovered in a Massachusetts family with historical ties; it was kept ungraded for 116 years by the Bernstein family.
Ken Goldin, featured in Netflix's 'King of Collectibles', is overseeing the auction, which closes on February 21, 2026.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman will start for Team USA against Denmark in his Olympic debut on Saturday.
Swayman, 27, has a 22-12-3 record with a 2.92 GAA and .903 save percentage this NHL season.
Team USA's previous starter, Connor Hellebuyck, will serve as backup, while Charlie McAvoy joins Swayman on the ice.
